en: â€œPride,â€ observed Mary, who piqued herself upon the solidity of her reflections, â€œis a very common failing, I believe. By all that I have ever read, I am convinced that it is very common indeed; that human nature is particularly prone to it, and that there are very few of us who do not cherish a feeling of self-complacency on the score of some quality or other, real or imaginary. Vanity and pride are different things, though the words are often used synonymously. A person may be proud without being vain. Pride relates more to our opinion of ourselves; vanity to what we would have others think of us.â€

Ka ntlha ya tsotlhe tse ke di balang, ke tlhomamisegile gore go aname go le kana kang; Go na le batho ba le mmalwa fela ba ba sa rateng go nna le boikutlo jwa go nna le boikutlo jwa go itlotla mo dilong tse di rileng kgotsa tse dingwe, tsa mmatota kgotsa tse re di akanyang. Boikgogomoso le boikgodiso ke dilo tse di farologaneng, le fa gantsi mafoko a dirisiwa go bua. Motho a ka nna a ikgogomosa fa a se na mosola. Go ikgogomosa go amana le tsela e re ikutlwang ka yone ka borona; Go na le dilo tse re ka ratang go di akanya ka batho ba bangwe."

mg: "Ny avonavona," hoy i Mary, izay nifantoka tamin'ny hamafin'ny fisaintsainany, "dia tsy fahombiazana mahazatra, mino aho. Amin'ny zavatra rehetra novakiako hatramin'izay, dia resy lahatra aho fa tena mahazatra tokoa izany; fa ny toetran'ny olombelona no tena mora iharan'izany, ary vitsy dia vitsy amintsika no tsy mankasitraka ny fahatsapana ny fizakan-tena amin'ny isa na toetra hafa, tena izy na foronina. Zavatra samy hafa ny fieboeboana sy ny avonavona, na dia matetika aza no ampiasaina amin'ny teny mitovy ny teny. Mety hirehareha ny olona iray nefa tsy ho zava-poana. Ny avonavona dia mifandray bebe kokoa amin'ny fomba fijerintsika ny tenantsika; Zava - poana ny zavatra tiantsika hataon'ny hafa amintsika."

en: â€œThere was just such an informality in the terms of the bequest as to give me no hope from law. A man of honour could not have doubted the intention, but Mr. Darcy chose to doubt itâ€”or to treat it as a merely conditional recommendation, and to assert that I had forfeited all claim to it by extravagance, imprudence, in short, anything or nothing. Certain it is that the living became vacant two years ago, exactly as I was of an age to hold it, and that it was given to another man; and no less certain is it, that I cannot accuse myself of having really done anything to deserve to lose it. I have a warm unguarded temper, and I may perhaps have sometimes spoken my opinion of him, and to him, too freely. I can recall nothing worse. But the fact is, that we are very different sort of men, and that he hates me.â€

U ka be u bile le kutlo e nyane mahlong a ka, ho ne ho se na boikemisetso bona bo fokolang; Empa e-re ke u tiisetsa hore ke na le tumello ea 'mÃ¨ ea hlomphehang bakeng sa aterese ena. U ka 'na ua se ke ua belaela hore na ke mang ea nang le bothata ba ho bua le uena, leha ho le joalo u ka etsa hore u se ke ua tsilatsila; Tlhokomelo ea ka e ne e tÅ¡oailoe haholo hore e fosahetse. tn: "Dumela, Mma Ausi, ke a go rata, go sa le kgakala le go go direla dilo tse di sa go tshwanelang, go na le go oketsa dilo tse dingwe tse o di dirang. O ka bo o le mo matlhong a me, o ka bo o sa tlhole o le teng, o ka bo o sa tlhole o le teng. Le fa go ntse jalo, ke tla go tlhomamisetsa gore ke na le tetla ya ga mme wa gago yo o tlotlegang wa aterese eno. O ka nna wa se ka wa belaela go bua le ene, le fa go ntse jalo, go ka go thusa gore o se ka wa dira gore o se ka wa dira gore o se ka wa akanya ka tsela e e utlwalang sentle. Tlhokomelo ya me e ne e le teng thata gore e ka se ka ya nna teng. Fa ke sena go tsena mo ntlong, ke ne ka go naya molekane wa me gore o nne tsala ya me ya botshelo jwa me. Le fa go ntse jalo, fa ke ne ke le mo tseleng e ke ikutlwang ka yone, go ka nna molemo gore ke kgone go akanya ka dilo tse ke neng ke di dira pele ga lenyalo la me, ka gonne ke ne ke le mo tseleng e ke neng ke batla go nna le yone." - Anne.

Ho tsy dia nahafinaritra loatra ianao teo imasoko raha toa ka tsy nisy izany tsy fahavononana kely izany; fa avelao aho hanome toky anao fa manana ny fahazoan-dalana avy amin'ny reninao hajaina aho amin'ity adiresy ity. Tsy afaka ny hisalasala amin'ny filazana ny lahateniko ianao, na izany aza dia mety hitarika anao ho amin'ny fikororosiana ny sakafo ara-boajanaharyo; Diso hevitra loatra aho ka tsy diso hevitra. Vantany vao niditra ny trano aho dia nanavaka anao ho mpiara-mitory amin'ny fiainako ho avy. Saingy alohan'ny handositrahako ny fihetseham-poko momba io lohahevitra io, dia angamba tsara ho ahy ny milaza ny antony nanambadiakoâ€”ary ankoatra izany, noho ny fahatongavako tao Hertfordshire niaraka tamin'ny famolavolana ny fisafidianana vady, tahaka ny nataoko tokoa."

en: â€œYou must give me leave to flatter myself, my dear cousin, that your refusal of my addresses are merely words of course. My reasons for believing it are briefly these:â€”It does not appear to me that my hand is unworthy your acceptance, or that the establishment I can offer would be any other than highly desirable. My situation in life, my connections with the family of De Bourgh, and my relationship to your own, are circumstances highly in my favour; and you should take it into further consideration that, in spite of your manifold attractions, it is by no means certain that another offer of marriage may ever be made you. Your portion is unhappily so small, that it will in all likelihood undo the effects of your loveliness and amiable qualifications. As I must, therefore, conclude that you are not serious in your rejection of me, I shall choose to attribute it to your wish of increasing my love by suspense, according to the usual practice of elegant females.â€

Lebaka la ka la ho lumela hore ke ka bokhutÅ¡oanyane tsena: ..."Hape ha ho bonahale eka letsoho la ka le sa tÅ¡oanelehe kamohelo ea hau, kapa hore ho theoa hoo nka fanang ka e ne e tla ba leha e le efe ntle le e lakatsehang haholo. Boemo ba ka bophelong, likhokahano tsa ka le lelapa la De Bourgh, le kamano ea ka le uena, ke maemo haholo molemong oa ka; 'Me u lokela ho nahana ka ho eketsehileng hore, ho sa tsotellehe lintho tse hohelang hao, ho ke ke ha e-ba le bonnete ba hore nyehelo e' ngoe ea lenyalo ka 'na ba kile ua etsoa u. Karolo ea hau ha e thabe haholo hoo e ka bang monyetla oa ho fokotsa litlamorao tsa lerato la hau le mangolo a tsoang ho amiable. Joalokaha ke tlameha, ka hona, etsa qeto ea hore ha u tebile ho lahloa ha hao, ke tla khetha ho e ananela takatso ea hau ea ho eketsa lerato la ka ka ho fetisisa, ho latela tloaelo e tloaelehileng ea basali ba elegantne. tn: "Ke kopa gore o se ka wa ntlhoboga, ke kopa gore o se ka wa dira gore ke bue le nna ke le nosi. Ka jalo, ke ne ke sa dumele gore go na le sengwe se ke ka se dirang gore ke kgone go dira dilo tse di sa siamang tse di ka go thusang ka tsela e e utlwalang sentle: "Ga go na mosola ope yo o ka dirang gore ke kgone go dira dilo tse di tshwanang le tse di sa siamang." - Diane 2:16. Ke na le kamano ya me le ba lelapa la ga Jehofa le ba lelapa la me la ga Jehofa, ke dilo tse ke di ratang thata mo botshelong jwa me; Le fa go ntse jalo, ela tlhoko gore le fa go na le dilo tse o di ratang, ga go na sepe se o ka se dirang gore o nne le seabe mo lenyalong. O na le bokgoni jo bo sa itumediseng thata, mme o ka se ka wa dira gore o se ka wa dira dilo tse o di ratang le tse o ka di dirisang. Ka jalo, ka jalo, ke tla swetsa ka gore ga o a tshwanela go ganana le wena, ke tla tlhopha go go naya keletso ya gago ya go oketsa lorato lwa me ka go dirisa mekgwa e e tlwaelegileng ya basadi ba ba nang le bokgoni."

en: â€œâ€˜When my brother left us yesterday, he imagined that the business which took him to London might be concluded in three or four days; but as we are certain it cannot be so, and at the same time convinced that when Charles gets to town he will be in no hurry to leave it again, we have determined on following him thither, that he may not be obliged to spend his vacant hours in a comfortless hotel. Many of my acquaintance are already there for the winter: I wish I could hear that you, my dearest friend, had any intention of making one in the crowd, but of that I despair. I sincerely hope your Christmas in Hertfordshire may abound in the gaieties which that season generally brings, and that your beaux will be so numerous as to prevent your feeling the loss of the three of whom we shall deprive you.â€™

tn: "Fa mokaulengwe wa me a re tlogela maabane, o ne a akanya gore kgwebo e e mo tsereng kwa London e ka wediwa mo malatsing a le mararo kgotsa a le mane; Le fa go ntse jalo, re ka tlhomamisega gore fa Charles a goroga kwa motseng, o tla bo a sa itlhaganelele go tswa mo go ene, re ne ra swetsa ka gore o tla bo a sa patelesega go fetsa diura tsa gagwe tse di se nang mosola kwa hoteleng e e sa iketlang. Le fa go ntse jalo, ke ne ke itse gore wena, tsala ya me e e rategang, ke ne ke na le maikaelelo a go dira sengwe mo bontsing jwa batho, mme gone ke ne ke sa tlhomamisege. I have nothing to say against him: he is a most interesting young man; and if he had the fortune he ought to have, I should think you could not do better. But as it isâ€”you must not let your fancy run away with you. You have sense, and we all expect you to use it. Your father would depend on your resolution and good conduct, I am sure. You must not disappoint your father.â€

Ga ke na sepe se nka se buang kgatlhanong le ene: Ke lekau le le kgatlhisang thata; Fa o ka bo o na le sengwe se a ka se dirang, ke ne ke akanya gore o ka se kgone go dira botoka. 15Mme wena, ga o a tshwanela go letla sepe se se sa tsamayeng le wena. O na le tlhaloganyo e bile rotlhe re solofela gore o tla e dirisa. Batsadi ba gago ba tla ikaega ka tsela e e molemo le tsela e o itshwarang ka yone. en: â€œAnd this,â€ cried Darcy, as he walked with quick steps across the room, â€œis your opinion of me! This is the estimation in which you hold me! I thank you for explaining it so fully. My faults, according to this calculation, are heavy indeed! But, perhaps,â€ added he, stopping in his walk, and turning towards her, â€œthese offences might have been overlooked, had not your pride been hurt by my honest confession of the scruples that had long prevented my forming any serious design. These bitter accusations might have been suppressed, had I, with greater policy, concealed my struggles, and flattered you into the belief of my being impelled by unqualified, unalloyed inclination; by reason, by reflection, by everything. But disguise of every sort is my abhorrence. Nor am I ashamed of the feelings I related. They were natural and just. Could you expect me to rejoice in the inferiority of your connections?â€”to congratulate myself on the hope of relations whose condition in life is so decidedly beneath my own?â€

Empa, mohlomong," a eketsa, a emisa tseleng ea hae, 'me a retelehela ho eena, "liphoso tsena li ka 'na tsa hlokomolohuoa, e ne e se boikhohomoso ba hau bo utloile bohloko ke boipolelo ba ka ba botÅ¡epehi ba li-scruples tse neng li thibetse ho theha moralo ofe kapa ofe o tebileng. 10Ka baka leo, le nna, ha ke ne ke patile diqoso tsa ka, ka o nyefola, ka baka la ho se dumele ha ka, ka baka la ho hloka toka, ka baka la ho hloka toka. Ka ho nahanisisa, ka ntho e 'ngoe le e' ngoe. Ka hoÊ»ouluÊ»ana a me ka hoÊ»ouluÊ»ana a me ka hoÊ»oha Ha ke hlajoe ke lihlong ka maikutlo a ka. E ne e le tlhaho le ka bo eona feela. Na u ne u ka lebella hore ke thabele ho se lekane ha likhokahanyo tsa hau?+ Ho thoholetsa tÅ¡epo ea likamano tseo boemo ba tsona bophelong bo leng qeto ea hore bo tlas'a ka?

tn: "Mme," ha hoeletsa, ha a ntse a tsamaya ka tsela e potlakileng ka phapusing, "ke maikutlo a hao! That's the one ya got me! Ke leboga go bo lo tlhalosa ka botlalo. Go ya ka pego e, go ya ka pego eno, go a bo go le boima tota! Le fa go ntse jalo, o ne a re: "Gongwe go ka direga gore o se ka wa dira dilo tse di sa siamang, o ka bo o sa tlhole o le mo kotsing ka gonne ke ne ke sa kgone go dira dilo tse di bosula tse di neng di sa tsamaye nako e telele. 13Ke ka moo ke neng ke sa dumele gore ke ne ka dira dilo tse di bosula tse ke di dirileng, ka ba ka di itshokela, ka ba ka di itshokela, ka ba ka di dira, ka ba ka se ka ba dumela mo go nna, ka go se na ope yo o sa itekanelang, yo o sa dumeleng, yo o sa dumeleng go nna yo o sa dumeleng, yo o sa dumeleng go nna yo o sa dumeleng, o o sa dumeleng; go tlhatlhanya ka sengwe le sengwe. Le fa go ntse jalo, go na le dilo tse di sa tshwaneng le tse dingwe tse di sa tshwaneng le tse di sa ntseng di le teng ke tsa me. Le fa go ntse jalo, ga ke tlhajwe ke ditlhong ka ntlha ya kafa ke ikutlwang ka teng. E ne e le tsa tlhago, e bile di le ka tlholego. A o ka rata go nna le tsholofelo ya go nna le tsholofelo ya go nna le kamano e e molemo mo botshelong jwa me?

mg: "Ary ity," hoy i Darcy nitomany, raha nandeha tamin'ny dingana haingana namakivaky ny efitrano izy, "dia ny hevitrao momba ahy! Izany no tombantombana izay mihazona ahy! Misaotra anao nanazava izany tamin'ny fomba feno. Tena mavesatra tokoa ny fahadisoako, araka io kajy io! Saingy, angamba," hoy izy nanampy, nijanona teo amin'ny diany, ary nitodika tany aminy, "mety ho tsy nohadinoina ireo fandikan-dalÃ na ireo, raha tsy naratra tamin'ny fibabohako tamin-kitsimpo ny fibabohako tamin-kitsimpo ireo scruples izay efa ela no nanakana ahy tsy hamorona drafitra matotra. Mety ho nofoanana ireo fiampangana mangidy ireo, raha toa aho, tamin'ny politika lehibe kokoa, nanafina ny tolona nataoko ary nanasohaso anareo tamin'ny finoana fa voatosiky ny fironana tsy mendrika sy tsy misy fotony aho; amin'ny alalan'ny fisainana, amin'ny alalan'ny fisaintsainana, amin'ny zavatra rehetra. Fa ny fanafenana ny karazan-javatra rehetra dia ny rikorikoko. Tsy menatra koa aho noho ny fihetseham - po nifandraikako. Ara-dalÃ na sy ara-drariny izy ireo. Afaka manantena ve ianao fa hifaly amin'ny fahambonian'ny fifandraisanareo aho?â€”mba hiarahabako ny tenako amin'ny fanantenana fifandraisana izay tena ambanin'ny toe-javatra iainan'izy ireo ny fiainany?"

en: But when this subject was succeeded by his account of Mr. Wickhamâ€”when she read, with somewhat clearer attention, a relation of events which, if true, must overthrow every cherished opinion of his worth, and which bore so alarming an affinity to his own history of himselfâ€”her feelings were yet more acutely painful and more difficult of definition. Astonishment, apprehension, and even horror, oppressed her. She wished to discredit it entirely, repeatedly exclaiming, â€œThis must be false! This cannot be! This must be the grossest falsehood!â€â€”and when she had gone through the whole letter, though scarcely knowing anything of the last page or two, put it hastily away, protesting that she would not regard it, that she would never look in it again.

tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, fa go ne go le thata go lemoga gore, fa a ne a bua, o ne a na le maikutlo a a kwa godimo a a neng a le botlhokwa thata le go feta, a a neng a sa ntse a le pelo e e botlhoko le e e seng kana ka sepe. Le fa go ntse jalo, go hutsafala le go tshosa, go ne go le thata go mo gatelela. O ne a leka go mo raya a re: "Seno se tshwanetse go nna se se phoso! Go ka se kgonege! E tshwanetse ya bo e le tsietso e kgolo go di gaisa tsotlhe!" Fa a ne a le mo go yone, le fa a ne a itse sengwe sa bofelo kgotsa a le mabedi, a se ka a se bona, a se ka a tlhola a se bona, a se ka a tlhola a se bona.

mg: Saingy rehefa nahomby tamin'ny fitantarany an'Atoa Wickham io lohahevitra ioâ€”rehefa namaky izy, tamim-pahamatorana kokoa, ny fifandraisan'ny zava-nitranga izay, raha marina, dia tsy maintsy mandrava ny fomba fijery ankafiziny rehetra momba ny maha-izy azy, ary nitondra fifandraisana tena nampivarahontsana tamin'ny tantarany manokanaâ€”dia mbola narary mafy sy sarotra kokoa ny famaritana azy. Nampahory azy ny tahotra, ny tahotra, ary ny horohoro mihitsy aza. Naniry ny hanala baraka tanteraka izany izy, ary namerimberina nihiaka hoe: "Tsy maintsy diso izany! Tsy mety izany! Izany no lainga lehibe indrindra! " Ary rehefa namaky ny taratasy iray manontolo izy, na dia zara raha nahafantatra na inona na inona momba ilay pejy farany na roa aza, dia nesoriny haingana ilay izy, nanohitra ny tsy hijereny izany intsony, fa tsy hijery izany intsony izy.

en: Elizabeth, however, had never been blind to the impropriety of her fatherâ€™s behaviour as a husband. She had always seen it with pain; but respecting his abilities, and grateful for his affectionate treatment of herself, she endeavoured to forget what she could not overlook, and to banish from her thoughts that continual breach of conjugal obligation and decorum which, in exposing his wife to the contempt of her own children, was so highly reprehensible. But she had never felt so strongly as now the disadvantages which must attend the children of so unsuitable a marriage, nor ever been so fully aware of the evils arising from so ill-judged a direction of talentsâ€”talents which, rightly used, might at least have preserved the respectability of his daughters, even if incapable of enlarging the mind of his wife.
es: Elizabeth, no obstante, nunca habÃ­a dejado de reconocer la inconveniencia de la conducta de su padre como marido. Siempre la habÃ­a observado con pena, pero respetaba su talento y le agradecÃ­a su cariÃ±o, por lo que procuraba olvidar lo que no podÃ­a ignorar y apartar de sus pensamientos su continua infracciÃ³n de los deberes conyugales y del decoro que, por el hecho de exponer a su esposa al desprecio de sus propias hijas, era tan sumamente reprochable. Pero nunca habÃ­a sentido como entonces los males que puede causar a los hijos un matrimonio mal avenido, ni nunca se habÃ­a dado cuenta tan claramente de los peligros que entraÃ±a la direcciÃ³n errada del talento, talento que, bien empleado, aunque no hubiese basta-do para aumentar la inteligencia de su mujer, habrÃ­a podido, al menos, conservar la respetabilidad de las hijas.

st: Leha ho le joalo, elizabetha ha aa ka a lebala boitÅ¡oaro ba ntate oa hae joaloka monna. O ne a lula a e-na le bohloko bo boholo; Empa ho hlompha bokhoni ba hae, mme a leboha kalafo ea hae e lerato, o lekile ho lebala seo a ke keng a se lebala, le ho lahla mehopolo ea hae e sa khaotseng ea boitlamo le decorum eo, ho pepesa mosali oa hae nyelisong ea bana ba hae, e ne e le ntho e sa lebaleheng haholo. Empa ha ho mohla a kileng a ikutloa a le matla joalo ka hona joale mefokolo e tlamehang ho ba teng ho bana ba lenyalo le sa tÅ¡oaneleheng, leha e le hore ba ne ba tseba ka botlalo bobe boo bo hlahang ho tsoa ho hampe a ahlolela tataiso ea litalenta tse itÅ¡etlehileng ka litalenta tseo, tse sebelisoang ka nepo, li ka 'na tsa boloka tlhompho ea barali ba hae, esita le haeba ho ke ke ha khoneha ho holisa kelello ea mosali oa hae.

tn: Le fa go ntse jalo, Ga go ise go ke go nne le motho yo o neng a le mo lenyalong la ga Rraagwe yo o neng a le mo lenyalong. O ne a bona botlhoko ka dinako tsotlhe; Le fa go ntse jalo, fa a ne a le pelo ya gagwe, o ne a leka go lebala se a neng a ka se kgone go se itlhokomolosa, le go itlhokomolosa maikutlo a gagwe a a neng a sa amogelesege. Le fa go ntse jalo, ga a ise a ke a nne le mathata a go nna teng ga bana ba lenyalo, le fa e le gore ga a ise a lemoge gore go na le dilo tse di sa siamang tse a di dirang, tse di neng di le mo tseleng e a neng a e dirisa ka yone, e ka tswa e le gore e ka nna ya nna ya nna le seabe mo baneng ba gagwe, tota le fa e le gore o ne a sa kgone go godisa mogopolo wa mosadi wa gagwe.

en: They descended the hill, crossed the bridge, and drove to the door; and, while examining the nearer aspect of the house, all her apprehension of meeting its owner returned. She dreaded lest the chambermaid had been mistaken. On applying to see the place, they were admitted into the hall; and Elizabeth, as they waited for the housekeeper, had leisure to wonder at her being where she was.
